section.title: Tutorial 4: Bags and History
section.para: All queries in FlyMine can be performed on lists or 'bags' that you create yourself. Bags are holders for lists of data, e.g. a list of gene identifiers. Saved bags of data can be used to constrain queries (either in a template query or in the QueryBuilder), perform logical operations (union, intersect, subtract) and can be exported.

listitem.para: Bags can be created from an external source: click on 'Bags' on the top menu bar of any FlyMine page and type or past in a list of identifiers, or upload a file containing the list.

Data from previous queries can also be saved into a bag. To save your data to a bag select the required data on a result page and either add it to an existing bag or save it to a new bag, using the boxes displayed underneath the results. Selecting the check boxes next to the column headings will select the entire column for saving. Alternatively, individual items can be saved by selecting check boxes next to the items.

section.para: This tutorial will illustrate how to create bags and how to make use of bags. As an example, we will search for the orthologues of D. melanogaster eye specification genes in D. pseudoobscura. We will then export the gene sequences for all the orthologues at once. To find the orthologues of the D. melanogaster genes in D. pseudoobscura, we will first make a bag of the D. melanogaster genes. Click on 'Bags' in the top menu bar.

listitem.para: Either type or cut and paste in a list of identifiers, or upload a list from a file. As an example, type in the gene symbols 'ey', 'eya', 'toy', 'dac' and 'so' into the box.
Enter a name for your bag, e.g. 'eye-genes_dmel' (or leave the default) by 'Name for new bag'.
Click on 'Make identifier bag' to save your bag.

section.para: Now we want to find all the orthologous genes in D. pseudoobscura using an existing template. Find the template 'Gene --> Orthologues in one specific organism' (Comparative Genomics aspect).

Any variable in a template query can be constrained to a bag (or 'not in' a bag) rather than a single value. Click on the check-box below the Synonym value box to constrain the gene synonym value to be in a bag. If you have bags saved in your 'MyMine' the option to constrain each variable to a bag will appear automatically. The name of the bag you just created will appear in the drop-down menu. Select the right organisms from the two other drop-down menus and run the query.
The results table shows the D. melanogaster genes with their corresponding orthologues in D. pseudoobscura. Only 4 out of the 5 D. melanogaster genes have orthologues in D. pseudoobscura.
Save the orthologous genes in a new bag:

listitem.para: Click on the check-box in the title of column 4 which contains the gene symbols for the orthologues. This selects all items in the column (on every result page, if more than one page). Alternatively, select individual items in the column.
At the bottom of the page is an option to save the selected results in a new bag. Choose a new bag name e.g. 'eye-genes_dpse' and click 'Save'.

section.para: Bags of data, as well as previously executed queries, can be retrieved from your MyMine page at the top menu bar on any FlyMine page (bags can also be directly accessed through the 'Bags' link). Your bags and query history will remain available to you only for the duration of a session unless you create and use a login. If you log in (via button on top menu bar), your bags and query history can be stored permanently. Click on 'MyMine' in the top menu bar.
To find out how to export the contents of a bag, see Tutorial 5.
